newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Nedlloyd's ECT stake to P&O joint venture.
newsitem.headline: Nedlloyd's ECT stake to P&O joint venture.

text.p: Shipping and road transport group Koninklijke Nedlloyd NV said on Monday it intends to transfer its 30.56 percent stake in Europe Combined Terminals (ECT) to its joint venture P&O Nedlloyd Container Line Ltd.
Other shareholders in ECT are Internatio-Mueller NV, Koninklijke Pakhoed and the state-owned Dutch Railways.

These firms have a right of first refusal in case one of the co-owners sells its interest but the three firms have already agreed to transfer the stake to the joint venture with Peninsular and Oriental Steam Navigation, Nedlloyd said.

Nedlloyd intends to transfer its ECT stake to its subsidiary Nedlloyd Lijnen BV before December 31 of this year. At or around January 1, Nedlloyd Lijnen will be merged into P&O Nedlloyd Container Line Ltd.
Last week, Nedlloyd's shareholders approved the container shipping division merger with P&O after the European Commission had already given the green light to the transaction.
